thread.title: Algeria: Air Algérie - Open Sky Requires Modernization
thread.title_full: Algeria: Air Algérie - Open Sky Requires Modernization

title: Algeria: Air Algérie - Open Sky Requires Modernization
text:
Liberia: Senate to Cite Public Works, Finance and Transport Minsters 
Algiers — The Algerian airspace will be opened provided that the national company improves the quality of its services and meets the level required by international standards, Minister of Transport Boudjama Talai said Sunday in Algiers. 
"When the national company Air Algérie offers to customers a quality service according to international standards and comparable to that of other airlines, the Open Sky will bother anyone," said Talai at an inspection visit to the Houari Boumediene International airport. 
A modernization plan is being implemented to improve the management and quality of service of the national company and make it competitive, the minister said. 
He recalled Air Algérie's restructuring plan will create four subsidiaries: catering (meals for passengers), freight transport (cargo), the handling (loading and baggage check), maintenance and repair of aircraft of Air Algérie and other airlines. 
The modernization plan also includes the reorganization of flights and the strengthening of the company fleet which currently consists of forty units. 
"Flights will be reorganized. The lines will be reinforced by means of transport based on the flow of travellers. Priority will be given to the most requested and popular lines," he said. 
At Houari Boumediene International Airport, Talai received explanations about the activities of this infrastructure, which recorded 6.4 million passengers in 2014. Algeria
